SEARCH

Package gw.transaction

package gw.transaction
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    gw
     
  • Class
    Description
    AbstractBundleTransactionCallback
    Simple base class that provides a no-op for all interface methods.
    BundleTransactionCallback
    Defines a block of code that can be registered with a bundle to run during the database transaction used when the bundle is committed.
    BundleTransactionCallbackExt
    Optional interface that allows implementations of BundleTransactionCallback to receive the exception thrown (if any) in the BundleTransactionCallbackExt.afterCommit(Bundle, boolean, Exception) callback method.
    ConnectionUtil
    DANGER: Usage of this class creates a very real possibility of exhausting the database connection pool which would result in a complete failure of the system.
    DataConflictException
    Thrown when there is a possibility of a lost update occurring due to one or more beans in a Bundle having data that is in conflict with data in the database.
    PublicServiceToken
    This interface exposes some of the accessor methods on the ServiceToken, and used in gw.transaction.Transaction to safely manipulate create, fetch, and set this object.
    ResourceAutoCloseable
    This class represents an AutoCloseable for resources, whose return does not throw an exception.
    Transaction
    Helper class used to get the current transaction bundle or to start a new bundle transaction.
    Transaction.BlockRunnable
    Runnable block of code passed a Bundle.
    Transaction.FunctionWithException<T,R>
    A Function that accepts a T and returns a R, except that the apply method may throw an Exception
    Transaction.RunnableWithException
    A runnable block of code that can throw an Exception
